definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
and/moreover/yet/for the time being/to be about to/both (... and...)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
straight (in a straight line)/continuously/always/from the beginning of ... up to .../all along
direct (opposite: indirect 間接|间接[jian4 jie1])/immediate/straightforward
live broadcast (not recorded)/direct Internet broadcasting/(agriculture) direct seeding
to sell directly/direct sale (by a factory)/direct marketing
municipality, namely: Beijing 北京, Tianjin 天津, Shanghai 上海 and Chongqing 重慶|重庆, the first level administrative subdivision/province level city/also called directly governed city
direct observation/directly perceived through the senses/intuitive/audiovisual

sentences.english: Roofless towers appeared and disappeared, thrusting blindly upward.
sentences.chinese: 無頂的塔不斷顯現又隱匿，盲目的直插雲霄。

sentences.english: But it caused nose bleeding if having too many of the roots.
sentences.chinese: 可是，有一回喫多了些，鼻子直冒血。

sentences.english: And grows erect as that comes home.
sentences.chinese: 當那隻腳回到家，它又把腰桿直起。

sentences.english: The omission of heat straightening may save energy and thus reduces production cost.
sentences.chinese: 特別是取消熱調直可節約能源，從而降低生產成本。

sentences.english: A knife was plunged up to the hilt in Rita's left breast.
sentences.chinese: 一把短刀齊柄直插在麗達的左胸上。

sentences.english: In the Asian version of this execution, the victim would stand upright and the sawing would begin at the top of the head.
sentences.chinese: 在亞洲版的鋸刑中，犯人是站直的，行刑從頭部開始。

sentences.english: This is the straight mind, this is our practice in the dojo.
sentences.chinese: 這便是直心，這纔是我們修行的道場。

sentences.english: The new sequences can be used in many areas.
sentences.chinese: 此外新序列在實數中取直，因此更加實用。

sentences.english: Their conversations straightly pass through my ears.
sentences.chinese: 他們的談話內容直穿過我的耳朵。

sentences.english: These are two modes of the direct power supply.
sentences.chinese: 這是宏觀上確定的兩個直供電模式。

sentences.english: Hard, wiry and straight, lying close to the body with a definite undercoat.
sentences.chinese: 剛毛，毛質硬且直，緊貼身體，有一定的底毛。

sentences.english: He buffed the wood until it shone.
China is one of the most powerful countries in the world.
sentences.chinese: 直目下現古是天下上最具有影響力的國家之一。

sentences.english: These soldiers are standing very straight.
This vision who can see people straight face?
sentences.chinese: 誰有這眼力能從面部直看到人心？

definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
askew/at a crooked angle/devious/noxious/(coll.) to lie on one's side
to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
waist and back/fig. upright and still healthy
calf (back of the leg below the knee)
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
